column1: Roasted coffee bean, coconut and toasted oak aromas lead the nose. The tight, austere palate offers prune, vanilla and clove alongside close-grained, assertive tannins. KERIN O’KEEFE
Delicate aromas of cedar, baking spice and dark fruit lead the nose. The straightforward palate suggests sour cherry, clove and toasted hazelnut alongside chewy tannins. KERIN O’KEEFE

Subdued aromas of mocha, leather and tobacco slowly emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers sour cherry, roasted coffee bean and coconut alongside tight, astringent tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink after 2023. KERIN O’KEEFE

Grilled onion, minestrone and broth aromas lead the nose. The palate shows soy sauce and crushed dill, but it lacks fruit richness. Drying, aggressive tannins leave an astringent finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

Earthy aromas of leather, scorched earth and dark-skinned berries lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and vanilla alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2021. KERIN O’KEEFE

The light-bodied palate is refreshing and lively, driven by lemon and yellow apple flavors at first, with melon arising on the midpalate. The finish is crisp and clean. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Forest floor, red berry, leather and pipe tobacco aromas are front and center. The intense, full-bodied palate offers impressive structure and finesse, delivering succulent Marasca cherry, cinnamon, star anise and a hint of hazelnut alongside assertive but noble tannins and vibrant acidity. It already shows focus and depth, but give it time to fully bloom. Drink 2026–2038. KERIN O’KEEFE

Red berry, violet, forest floor, vanilla and balsamic aromas of menthol and camphor slowly appear on this stunning, radiant red along with whiffs of charcuterie. The vibrant, focused palate is young and taut but already impeccably balanced, evoking juicy red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and cool mint framed in firm acidity and tightly knit but fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It's already fantastic but will hold for even more complexity. Best 2026–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

It's focused and delicious, with juicy Marasca cherry, star anise, clove and mocha flavors framed in taut, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2026–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of underbrush, camphor, violet, dark culinary spices, new leather and dark-skinned fruit lead the way. The structured, full-bodied palate shows juicy red cherry, raspberry, orange zest, ground clove, star anise and truffle alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. It boasts elegance and structure. Drink 2024–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Forest floor, new leather, underbrush and eucalyptus aromas mingle with a whiff of peppercorn. On the full-bodied, focused palate, tightly knit, noble tannins and bright acidity frame juicy Morello cherry, licorice, tobacco and a hint of truffle. Drink 2026–2036. Cellar Selection. KERIN O’KEEFE

Rose, violet, just-tilled vineyard soil and perfumed berry are just some of the aromas you'll find on this dazzling, fragrant red. The elegant, delicious palate is chock-full of elegance and flavor, delivering juicy Morello cherry, raspberry compote, cake spice and a balsamic note. It boasts fantastic tension and finesse, and will be even better with more bottle age. Gorgeous. Drink 2026–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Rose petal, iris, dark-skinned berry and spice aromas mingle with balsamic notes of camphor on this fragrant, stunning red. Elegantly structured, the precise palate evokes cranberry, Marasca cherry, star anise and thyme set against tightly knit but refined tannins and bright acidity. It's a quintessential Barbaresco, with fantastic tension. Drink 2024–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Reflecting the nose, the structured palate doles out juicy red cherry, pomegranate, licorice and a hint of tobacco alongside tightly knit, polished tannins and vibrant acidity. It's still youthfully austere with good aging potential. Drink 2022–2029. KERIN O’KEEFE

Drink 2026–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Best 2024–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Mirroring the nose, the enveloping, savory palate doles out tangerine zest, dried apricot, marzipan and bitter almond alongside still tangy acidity. A honeyed mineral note lingers on the close. Drink through 2024. KERIN O’KEEFE

Tightly woven but polished tannins and fresh acidity provide the framework, while a licorice note lingers on the close. Drink 2024–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Best 2024–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

The elegant, linear palate boasts great tension focus, offering juicy ripe apricot, juicy citrus and a smoky flint note alongside tangy acidity. It's mesmerizingly delicious and alluring, with a bone-dry finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of red berry, juniper and underbrush lead the nose. Made with 100% Cesanese, the wine has a juicy palate that offers red currant, clove and white pepper alongside smooth tannins and bright acidity. Drink soon to enjoy the fruit richness and freshness. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of toasted hazelnut, camphor and dark-skinned berry mingle with whiffs of coconut. Tight and taut, the linear palate reflects the nose, offering espresso, dried sage, licorice and prune alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Vite Colte 2016 La Casa in Collina (Barbaresco)

column1: Aromas of mature yellow stone fruit, cedar and Alpine herbs lift out of the glass. The aromas follow over to the taut, full-bodied palate along with oak-driven spice, coconut and citrus rind before a butterscotch close. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Cantina Tramin 2017 Unterbner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

column1: Graphite, grilled herb and mature yellow pear aromas come together in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the rounded, medium-bodied palate offers ripe golden apple, white peach and a tangy saline note. Fresh acidity lifts the finish. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Cantina Valle Isarco 2017 Aristos Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

column1: Red-skinned berry, leather, balsamic aromas and a toasted note lead the nose. The brawny palate offers Marasca cherry, raspberry jam, vanilla, sage and espresso alongside vigorous acidity and the heat of evident alcohol. Grainy tannins give it a drying, astringent close. KERIN O’KEEFE
